# Chapter 132

The Pope outleveled Malacus. His stats granted him superior combat power on paper. But numbers lied. His class was Priest, a support role built for healing and buffs. Combat ability? The worst among all classes.

The Pope's entire offensive arsenal consisted of Goddess' Breath. A single cast would've vaporized an ordinary user. His backup plan was raw magic bombardment, waves of energy that would've turned lesser players to ash. But rankers chose their classes deliberately. They built power. They trained for war.

"You called me stupid?" Asuka's face flushed red. "Even my father never said that to me."

She charged. Twin swords blurred as Transcend and Blacksmith's Rage timed out on Grid's status bar.

*What? She's faster than before.*

**Jjejeong!**

Grid grunted. Keeping pace with the dual blade assault pushed him to his limit. He snapped off Link.

**Chaaeng! Chaeeeeeng!**

Asuka blocked three of the seventeen strikes. Sword Frenzy intercepted nine more. Five landed clean. The party UI showed her health bar drop below half in an instant.

Toban tensed. Black Teddy remained calm beside Asuka. He knew berserkers better than anyone. Low health meant high damage.

**Kwakakakang!**

Grid blinked. Asuka's strikes accelerated, each impact biting deeper through his defenses.

> [You have suffered 1,900 damage.]

> [You have suffered 2,080 damage.]

*Why is she stronger?*

Grid recalled the Pavranium from their assault on Box. The golden discs orbited him, intercepting Asuka's assault.

**Chaaeng! Chaeeeeeng!**

The autonomous defense bought him breathing room.

"What is that item?" Asuka's eyes tracked the spinning blades. "Legendary rated?"

Grid ignored her. He drew the Ideal Dagger, activated Quick Movements, then swapped back to Dainsleif mid-dash.

"Shut up and die quickly!"

His Insight confirmed what his body already knew. Asuka's combat power was rising with every second. Grid abandoned offense. He let the Pavranium handle defense while he pressed forward, slamming Dainsleif down on her shoulder. The blade bit deep. He chained attacks during her stagger.

**Papat! Papapat!**

Stab wounds bloomed across Asuka's body. Her health dropped to twenty percent. That's when the real berserker emerged.

> [You have suffered serious damage. Maximizing the berserk effect.]

> [Attack power will increase by 80% and attack speed will increase by 50%.]

Fifty percent attack speed with heavy weapons was obscene. Asuka swapped her twin swords for a halberd larger than her entire frame.

**Chaaeng!**

Grid blocked. His arms buckled under the impact.

"Kuk?"

Toban saw an opening. He cast his buff.

"Fierce Momentum!"

> [Fierce Momentum is activated. You and your party's attack power will increase by 30%, while defense is reduced by 20%.]

Box layered his own skill.

"Magic Power Resonance!"

> [The effect of Magic Power Resonance is activated. The buff effect applied to you and your party members will increase by 1.5 times.]

"Ohhhhhh!"

Asuka roared. Power surged through her muscles. She swung the halberd, trailing crimson afterimages.

**Peeeeeong!**

Grid's feet left the ground. Dainsleif blocked the strike, but physics didn't care about immunity. His body launched skyward. Hell Chains materialized, black links wrapping his limbs. Chain Frenzy activated. Two seconds of airborne helplessness.

The white bear warrior charged through the gap, claws arcing toward Grid's exposed throat. Golden discs intercepted, sparking against bone and fur.

Asuka smiled. She'd been waiting for the discs to commit elsewhere. Half a second before Grid's captivity expired, she materialized the Onslaught Greatsword. Her highest damage weapon.

She jumped. The blade punched through Grid's chest.

"Kuaaaaak!"

Red flooded his vision.

> [You have been hit by a blow!]

> [You have suffered 29,900 damage.]

Holy Light Armor reduced physical damage by forty percent. Without it, that strike would've deleted his health bar entirely. Even with it, Grid's consciousness flickered.

**Flop.**

The Chain Frenzy timer expired. Grid collapsed, rolling across dirt. Blood pooled beneath him.

Box exhaled. *We can actually win this.*

Green light pulsed from Grid's finger. Doran's Ring triggered. Fifty percent of the damage converted to healing. But the Holy Light Armor had an option. Three hundred percent bonus to recovery magic.

Twenty-nine thousand, nine hundred damage. Doran's Ring restored half. Fourteen thousand, nine hundred and fifty health. The armor tripled it.

> [44,850 health has been restored.]

"Shit." Grid stood. "I almost died."

"Eh...?"

Asuka stared. No wounds. No blood. Not even a scratch where her blade had pierced his heart.

"What's this?"

Toban, Black Teddy, and Box froze.

Pagma's Swordsmanship: Kill came off cooldown. Asuka sensed the killing intent, swapping back to dual swords for defense. She couldn't handle it alone. Black Teddy commanded the white bear warrior forward.

The bear's health was already depleted from the Pavranium bombardment. Kill tore through fur, bone, and muscle. The summon evaporated. The skill continued, colliding with Asuka's crossed blades.

**Jjejeong!**

"Kyaaack!"

First time for everything. First defeat to another user. First player-driven death.

> [Your party member Asuka has died.]

"W-What?"

Their strongest member, gone. Toban felt half-amazed, half-devastated. Box trembled.

*This is enough.*

Box's obsession with Grid wasn't about his class like Asuka's. He was confirming Grid's worth. Checking if an invitation made sense. Box was a spy. He represented another guild.

"Grid! Leave the Tzedakah Guild and come to our guild. In the unified guild rankings, we areâ€”"

A black disc separated Box's head from his shoulders.

> [You have been hit by a lethal blow!]

> [You have died.]

*Crazy.*

They called him a psychopath for good reason. Who cuts someone's throat mid-sentence? Box died grimacing, his body dissolving into grey light.

Black Teddy and Toban remained. Black Teddy's face twisted with rage.

"You dare... How dare you kill the Young Lady!?"

Grid glared back. "I'm wrong for killing her? Think about it. Who attacked first? Who tried to kill me? Who should be angry right now?" His voice rose. "Ah, shit. I'm angrier the more I think about it. Die."

Black Teddy was strong. Not strong enough. His pets were dead, resurrection timers still counting down. Grid attacked. Black Teddy became light.

Toban stood alone.

"Haha..." Nervous laughter escaped his throat.

Grid's smile was sharp. "Aren't you good at acting? You should receive something at this year's acting awards."

"Haha..."

The laughter continued. Grid's expression darkened.

"Do you have any excuses?"

Toban had a conscience. Deception had limits. He bowed, voice cracking.

"I'm sorry! I was blinded by greed!"

Grid squatted in front of him. Extended his hand.

Toban stared at the open palm, confused.

"Give me money." Grid's tone was flat. "If you give me enough to soften my anger, I might forget about this. You don't have to. I'll just report you to Jishuka."

Jishuka's nature meant zero tolerance for traitors. Toban knew this better than anyone.

His inventory opened. Twenty thousand gold. Twenty-four million won in real currency. But Toban was genuinely sorry. Afraid of retaliation. He didn't hesitate.

Grid's anger cooled. Twenty-four million won from one battle wasn't a bad haul. He pocketed the gold.

"Okay. This is enough for now." Grid paused. "But I'm sorry. Don't even dream of having an item made by me."

"G-Grid...!"

Toban looked ready to cry. But guilt prevented him from begging forgiveness.

Grid's heart softened at the genuine regret. He offered a thread of hope.

"Well... Yes. I'll just forgive you. If you serve me like a slave, I'll make you an item someday..."

"...Thank you."

Serve as a slave? Toban couldn't decide if this was mercy or punishment. But he'd committed the betrayal. He had no choice but to accept.

Grid stood. "Stand up. Let's depart."

"Huh? Depart...? Where?"

Grid's smile turned sweet. "Let's go complete my quest. You've become my slave."

"..."

First ranked paladin. Sixty-eighth on the unified rankings. Chief of staff of the Tzedakah Guild.

Toban had just become Grid's property.
